title: Accounts Assistant Job at  Flour Mills of Nigeria
content:
Nigerian Eagle Flour Mills Limited (NEFM), a subsidiary of Flour Mills of Nigeria Plc, was incorporated in November 1979 to manufacture and market Flour and allied products like Semolina and Bran.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Assistant

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo

The Purpose


	To promptly settle vendor and transporter bills, and to maintain and implement efficient control systems that prevent duplication or overshooting of maintenance expenses and budget. 


The Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Process vendors’ documents in the M-Files system and forward them to the Head Office for payment processing.  
	Generate payment advice and communicate updates to vendors regarding bill settlements.  
	Reconcile vendor sub-ledgers with the general ledger on a monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis.  
	Ensure accurate three-way matching of Purchase Orders (PO), Waybills, and Invoices.  
	Maintain proper bookkeeping of all financial documents and general journal entries in M-Files.  
	Handle prompt processing of all PHFM-related payments, including staff salaries.  
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory payments (PAYE, Pension, Withholding Tax, VAT) to avoid penalties.  
	Participate actively in monthly stock counts and stock reconciliation exercises. 


Requirements
Qualifications:


	OND in Accounting or any other related discipline.  
	AAT Certification will be an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of two years of relevant work experience in a similar role. 


The Person Must:


	Possess good verbal and written communication skills.   
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office tools.  
	Strong attention to detail, organizational, and analytical skills.

title: Sales & Marketing Executive (Female) Job at Elliom Food Limited
content:
Elliom Food Limited is dedicated to producing high-quality bread and refined water. We use the finest ingredients to ensure exceptional taste and freshness and take the highest standard to provide hygienic drinking water. Our mission is to bring joy to our customers through our artisanal baking and clean water, while maintaining the highest standards of quality and hygiene.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales & Marketing Executive (Female) 

Job Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Promote and sell all Elliom Foods products (bread, pastries, beverages) to wholesalers, retailers, and direct consumers
	Identify new sales routes and business opportunities across Benin City
	Track customer feedback and relay market insights to management for product improvement
	Demonstrate product knowledge during customer interactions, ensuring high satisfaction
	Represent the company professionally in appearance and attitude at all times
	Meet weekly and monthly sales targets with dedication
	Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, vendors, and local communities
	Distribute samples and promotional materials to grow brand awareness
	Assist in organizing local marketing events, tastings, or product launches.


Requirements


	Minimum qualification: SSCE / WAEC / NECO
	Female applicants only
	Must be presentable, confident, and neat in appearance
	Ability to speak clearly in English, Pidgin, and/or Edo dialects
	Strong communication and persuasive skills
	Passionate about food and customer service
	Energetic, proactive, and ready to move around the city.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 per month
	Performance-based bonuses on sales
	Free accommodation provided.
	Opportunity to build a rewarding career in marketing
	Supportive and friendly work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: elliombakery@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Videographer / Editor Job at Sujimoto Construction Limited
content:
Sujimoto Construction Limited is a luxury real estate and construction company with a vision to dominate Nigeria's real estate industry. The firm covers all areas of construction, including the pre and post phases. Our major expertise is in luxury real estate development. We have also expanded our operations into facility management and direct construction, catering to the discerning real estate investor who wishes to be associated only with bespoke and iconic structures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer / Editor

Job Location: Lagos
job Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly experienced Videographer/Editor to join our dynamic creative team.
	The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of video production processes, from concept development to post-production, and will have a portfolio that showcases exceptional storytelling through visual media.
	This role requires a blend of technical expertise, artistic vision, and strong collaboration skills.


Responsibilities


	Video Production: Lead all aspects of video production, including pre-production planning, shooting, and post-production editing. Collaborate with creative teams to develop concepts and scripts that align with project goals.
	Filming: Operate professional video cameras, lighting, and sound equipment to capture high-quality footage. Ensure the highest production standards are met on all shoots.
	Editing: Utilize advanced editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve) to edit footage, create compelling narratives, and produce polished final products. Implement color grading, sound design, and visual effects as necessary.
	Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring deadlines are met while maintaining quality. Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders throughout the production process.
	Collaboration: Work closely with directors, producers, and other team members to brainstorm ideas, provide creative input, and incorporate feedback into projects.
	Quality Control: Review and critique video content for quality, accuracy, and adherence to brand standards. Ensure all projects are delivered on time and to specification.
	Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, techniques, and technologies. Propose new ideas and approaches to enhance the quality and impact of video content.


Requirements


	3 years+ of proven experience as a videographer/Editor
	Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Cap Cut or equivalent.
	Strong knowledge of lighting, composition, and audio techniques..
	Excellent attention to detail, creativity, and organizational skills.
	Experience with 4K and HDR video production.
	Knowledge of drone operation and aerial videography.
	Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and portfolio showcasing relevant work to: Best@sujimotonig.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Branch Manager Job at Covenant Microfinance Bank Limited
content:
Covenant Microfinance Bank Limited was incorporated as a private limited liability company on May 6, 2003 and commenced operations on March 15, 2004 as Covenant University Community Bank Limited (CUCB LTD). Converted to a Microfinance Bank in line with Central Bank of Nigeria’s directive to all Community Banks and commenced business as such on January 11, 2008.Granted license to operate as a State Microfinance Bank in December, 2012 having met the prescribed N100 million minimum capital requirement. In 2014, became one of the first Microfinance Banks to generate the 10-digit Nigeria Uniform Bank Account Number (NUBAN) for all its customers after successfully signing up for integration to NCS.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Branch Manager

Job Location: Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Business Development: Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities , growing existing customer relationships, and meeting sales targets.
	Team Management: Leading and motivating a team of bankers, providing guidance, coaching, and feedback to ensure high performance.
	Risk Management: Ensuring compliance with bank policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements, managing risk, and maintaining a safe and secure banking environment.
	Financial Management: Managing branch finances, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.
	Marketing and Promotion: Developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote bank products and services.
	Community Engagement: Building relationships with local businesses,organizations, and community groups to promote the bank's reputation and services.
	Problem-Solving: Resolving complex customer complaints, operational issues, and other branch-related problems.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications in a related field with experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter detailing their qualifications and experience to: career@covenantmfb.com.ng using “Branch Manager” as the subject of the email.

title: UI/UX Instructor Job at Fortesoft Systems Limited
